page.title: 07LOWER NILL FARM
page.content: MR.D.K.TAYLOR HAS LIVED AT LOWER NILL FARM SINCE 1943. HE RAISES ARABLE CROPS (250 ACRES OF WHEAT OIL-SEED RAPE AND BARLEY) AND CHICKENS. HE HAS A PROBLEM WITH GRASSWEEDS AND ALSO WITH CROPS BEING SPOILT BY THE WIND AND HEAVY RAIN. THE GRAIN FOM THE CROPS IS WASHED, DRESSED AND DRIED SO IT CAN BE USED FOR SEED PLANTING THE NEXT YEAR. THE REST IS SOLD OFF FOR FODDER. HE HAS 6 CHICKEN HOUSES WHICH CONTAIN 30,000 ROSS AND COBB CHICKENS. THE RAISING OF THE CHICKENS IS DONE IN A 7 WEEK CYCLE UNTIL THEY ARE FAT ENOUGH TO SELL. ON OUR FIRST VISIT TO THE FARM THEY WERE ALMOST READY TO BE SOLD AND THE CHICKEN HOUSES WERE VERY NOISY,SMELLY & FULL. OUR 2ND VISIT WAS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE CYCLE AND THE CHICKENS WERE TINY BUT EVEN THEN THEY WERE WORTH OVER Â£1 EACH. A VERY LARGE & IMPRESSIVE FARM.
